results.title: Caulfield: a Living City
results.creator_credit: Caulfield Film Society, Caulfield City Council, Ewart Wade and John Freney-Mills
results.brief_description:
Weekend activities in the City of Caulfield. Schools, churches, sporting and social service groups keep the city alive at weekends. Activities include the running of the Caulfield Cup, and quieter games such as tennis and bowls. School children learn road safety at special classes and attend the Youth Centre. For the elderly citizens there are “meals-on-wheels”.

results.title: Caught shoplifting
results.brief_description: Explores and illustrates the economic issues as well as the human motivations behind the act of shoplifting: the desire for adventure; plain boredom; a feeling of alienation or a need to conform. The film does more than direct attention to the scope and social consequences of shoplifting. It focuses on the greatest need to examine our individual understanding of ethics and morality, and to avoid the near occasions of self-indulgence in theft.

results.title: Caught in the net
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Still Water Pictures, Nathan Neumer, Lori Roth and David Tennant
results.brief_description: A thought provoking short documentary about exercising caution when developing friendships over the Internet and for the level of information that is disclosed. It does this through a discussion between two friends who have met and become friends in real life. This is compared to the relationship that is developing between one of them and someone he has ‘met’ over the Internet in a discussion room and via email. It questions issues such as what information is volunteered, what is held back, intuition, and whose on the other end of this unknown and faceless form of communication.

results.title: Caught In The Crowd
results.creator_credit: Norwood Primary School and India Thompson
results.brief_description:
Piper and Nick were best friends from a young age but as they grew up, Piper became one of the most popular girls in the school and studious Nick fell into the nerdy group. School bullies harass Nick while Piper looks on concerned. She is torn when Nick calls to her for help. Will Piper risk her popularity to respect their life-long friendship, or will she be caught in the crowd?
Written and directed by India Thompson with Film Support by Michael Hilbert and Sue Chapple. Cast includes: Piper Adams, Nicholas House, Emma Johnstone and Cameron Wicks.
Under the category ‘Primary Live Action’, Norwood Primary School’s 5/6 Chapple/Dennis class were the Screen It 2011 winners.

results.title: Caught
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Wolfgang Reinhardt and Max Ophuls
results.brief_description: Smith Ohrig, played by Robert Ryan, is a hedonistic, charming playboy (loosely based on Howard Hughes). Impulsively marrying ambitious, idealistic wanna-be model Leonora Eames (Barbara Bel Geddes), Ohrig keeps her a virtual prisoner in his palatial mansion, tormenting her with twisted mind games while he continues his premarital playboy activities. Coming to the realization that wealth and creature comforts are no substitute for stability, Leonora takes a job in the offices of society doctor Larry Quinada (James Mason). When Leonora finds comfort in the arms of the doctor, Ohrig becomes intent on destroying her. This is a classic film noir story of a young girl’s dream turning to nightmare.

results.title: Catuor
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Pierre Heberrt and Judith Klein
results.brief_description: This film is about cats - actually, one very clever cat. The title is a play on the French “quatuor” meaning quartet, but the chorus is not the usual alley cat variety. The cat in this film is talented indeed. It is both pianist and piano, trumpet and trumpeter, and, if need be, even becomes the music - a pulsing rock and roll - or a whole swarm of alley cats. Award: Madrid

results.title: Cattle trail
results.brief_description: Cattle on the Cascade Station in South Westland are rounded up twice yearly and taken on an arduous three weeks drive up the coast to the sale-yards at Wataroa. This film provides a record of the journey which traverses some of New Zealand’s finest forest, mountain, lake, river, and alpine scenery.

results.title: Cattle ranch
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Guy L. Cote
results.brief_description: The life of the cowboy, filmed through the seasons on Canada’s biggest cattle ranch near Kanloops, British Colombia. With musical accompaniment by American folk singer Peter Seeger and narration by Frances Hyland, ‘Cattle Ranch’ presents a vividly dramatic picture of the open range where a cowboy is king, where calves are born, live with the herd for a time in the splendour of mountain meadows, then join the trek to the city abattoir. Awards: Locarno; Rome; Vancouver; Montreal

results.title: Cattle king
results.creator_credit: Bill Bennett Productions and Bill Bennett
results.brief_description: The story of Sir Sydney Kidman and his battle with the Australian land. Kidman began as a roustabout and eventually came to control over a hundred properties and owned more cattle than any other person in the world. He attempted to avoid the full effects of Australia’s periodical droughts by buying up territories covering a wide area of Northern Australia. His policy was put to the test in 1901-1902 and 1926-30; his battle with the droughts of these years is dramatically portrayed.
